message.content:
cs.DM, cs.AI, cs.GT, cs.CC, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with the stable marriage and roommates problems, which are classic problems in discrete mathematics and algorithms. The use of preference lists and the concept of stable matching suggest that the paper belongs to the cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) sub-category. The investigation of the complexity and approximability of finding solutions with additional constraints suggests that the paper also belongs to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The use of game theory concepts such as blocking and stability suggests that the paper belongs to the cs.GT (Game Theory) sub-category. The discussion of polynomially solvable special cases suggests that the paper also belongs to the cs.CC (Computational Complexity) sub-category. Finally, the use of algorithms and the investigation of the complexity of finding solutions suggests that the paper also belongs to the cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) sub-category.
